intro: Erigeron elkoensis, commonly known as Elko fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It produces small, white to pale blue flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron elkoensis is often found in Nevada and Utah, where it thrives in arid conditions.
